sentence.Network_en: The wine was excellent, but the food was disappointing.
sentence.Network_cn: 酒棒极了，但是饭菜却让人不敢恭维。

sentence.Network_en: It was a disappointing result for the Greens who polled three percent.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个结果让绿党感到失望，他们只获得了3%的选票。

sentence.Network_en: The recession is largely blamed for the disappointing response to the appeal.
sentence.Network_cn: 对此呼吁的反应令人失望，主要归咎于经济衰退。

entry.tran: 令人失望的;令人沮丧的;令人扫兴的
entry.def: Something that is disappointing is not as good or as large as you hoped it would be.

example.ex: The wine was excellent, but the food was disappointing...
example.tran: 酒棒极了，但是饭菜却让人不敢恭维。

example.ex: The recession is largely blamed for the disappointing response to the appeal.
example.tran: 对此呼吁的反应令人失望，主要归咎于经济衰退。

sentences.sentence: "a disappointing performance from one who had seemed so promising"

auth_sentence.content: So the evidence at the moment is very disappointing.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: So the evidence at the moment is very disappointing.

auth_sentence.content: They have very good games with some disappointing results.
auth_sentence.res_content: They have very good games with some disappointing results.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They have very good games with some disappointing results.

auth_sentence.content: Europe was disappointing for United and Chelsea as well.
auth_sentence.res_content: Europe was disappointing for United and Chelsea as well.

Sentence.sentence: I heard the recent sculpture exhibit was kind of disappointing.

sentences.en: The speech was most disappointing,it skirted round all the main questions.
sentences.cn: 这篇演讲非常令人失望,它回避了所有主要的问题。
